title: Avengers' Chris Hemsworth on casting brothers in Marvel film
text:
Please make this happen (Picture: Getty Images)

Chris Hemsworth, Thor himself, has shared his thoughts on getting his brothers into the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

Quizzed on how he’d incorporate his famous brothers into the flick, Chris suggested both actors Liam and Luke would take on plum roles.

You know, should Chris take on a casting job in the process.

Attending the recent ACE Comic Con Midwest panel on Sunday, the 36-year-old was asked to dream cast his bros as superheroes made famous in the MCU.

‘I could make Luke the Incredible Hulk,’ Chris said, according to ComicBook.com. ‘He’s got some big arms on him. Some muscles.’

Thor’s position is safe (Picture: Rex Features)

Runs in the family.

When it came to Liam, Chris mused: ‘Liam we could make…we could change him to Captain Australia, maybe?

‘No? I don’t know.’

Still, there is no way Chris is going to bring his brothers in to replace the OG Avengers as he said: ‘I love my brothers, but I love that cast.’

Liam also auditioned for the role of Thor back in the day (Picture: @chrishemsworth)

Perhaps he can put the good word in Kevin Feige’s ear about some spots in the upcoming Phase Four of the MCU, eh?

Can we have a little lol about the fact Chris kept Liam far away from taking over his role of Thor, after the actor admitted his little brother also auditioned for the role back in the day.

And originally got further!

Previously speaking to W Magazine, Chris explained: ‘I came into the audition with Kenneth Branagh and thought I nailed it and then never heard anything back. Months went by and then my brother, my little brother, Liam, was in Australia and sent a tape across and he got a call back, then another call back and then was down to the last kind of four or five people for it.

‘I remember sitting in Vancouver, shooting Cabin in the Woods with Drew Goddard and Joss Whedon. Both of them were looking at the trades at this sort of top five guys for Thor and saying, “Why aren’t you in the mix here? What happened?” I said, “I don’t know. I blew my audition I guess.”’

After none of those guys got it, Chris continued: ‘My manager then called up and said, “You know, he’s got an older brother. Can we bring him back in?” So I did an audition in Vancouver in this hotel room with my mum reading Anthony Hopkins’ part.

‘She must have nailed it because it got me back in the room and that second audition was a lot different than my first one. I came in kind of with a little, I guess, motivation and maybe frustration that my little brother had gotten further than me.

‘It’s a little family, sibling rivalry sort of kicked up in me. Then it moved pretty quick from there. It was cool.’
